content: Electoral ward in Singapore **Hong Lim Constituency** was a [constituency](/wiki/Constituency) in [Chinatown](/wiki/Chinatown), Singapore. It was created in 1959 and dissolved in 1976 but is currently part of [Jalan Besar GRC](/wiki/Jalan_Besar_GRC) (Kreta Ayer–Kim Seng). The constituency dwindled in population since its creation. In 1968, 1,615 voters were shifted to Bukit Ho Swee. Later on, 5,162 voters were shifted to Serangoon private houses. The remaining people were merged into Telok Ayer. ## Member of Parliament **Election** **Member of Parliament****Party**[Legislative Assembly of Singapore](/wiki/Legislative_Assembly_of_Singapore)**1959**[Ong Eng Guan](/wiki/Ong_Eng_Guan)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1961**Independent**1963**[UPP](/wiki/United_People%27s_Party_(Singapore))**1965**[Lee Khoon Choy](/wiki/Lee_Khoon_Choy)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)[Parliament of Singapore](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore)**1968**[Lee Khoon Choy](/wiki/Lee_Khoon_Choy)[PAP](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party)**1972** Note : Ong Eng Guan resigned from the Legislative Assembly in 1965 ## Electoral results Note: The [Elections Department](/wiki/Elections_Department_Singapore) does not include rejected votes when calculating the vote shares of candidates. Hence, all candidates' vote shares will total to 100% at any given election (may not appear so in multi-way contests due to rounding). ### Elections in 1950s [General Election
